dependencies.title: System Dependencies
dependencies.installGuideIntro: To install or reinstall dependencies, please follow the instructions below to install manually in the terminal:
dependencies.missingDepsDetected: Missing dependencies detected, please see installation guide below

swift.name: Xcode Command Line Tools
swift.description: Apple official development tools, providing Swift compiler and basic development libraries
swift.installGuide: Run the above command in the terminal, an installation window will pop up, follow the prompts to complete the installation. The installation process may take several minutes to tens of minutes, please wait patiently.

brew.name: Homebrew
brew.description: Package manager for macOS, used to install and manage software packages
brew.installGuide: Run the above command in the terminal, follow the prompts to complete the installation. If the network is slow, you can use a domestic mirror source.

macfuse.name: MacFUSE
macfuse.description: File system user space framework, required by ntfs-3g
macfuse.installGuide: Homebrew must be installed first. Run the above command in the terminal to install.

ntfs3g.name: ntfs-3g
ntfs3g.description: NTFS file system driver, providing NTFS read-write support
ntfs3g.installGuide: Homebrew and MacFUSE must be installed first. Run the above command in the terminal to install.

fswatch.name: fswatch (Optional)
fswatch.description: File system event monitoring tool for zero-latency device detection (event-driven mode)
fswatch.installGuide: fswatch is an optional performance optimization tool. After installation, it enables zero-latency device detection and reduces CPU usage by 90%+. Run the above command to install.

macosVersion.name: macOS Version ({version})
macosVersion.description: System version check to ensure macOS version meets requirements (macOS 14 or higher required)
macosVersion.installGuide: If your macOS version is too low, please upgrade your system through System Settings > Software Update. This tool requires macOS 14 (Sonoma) or higher to run properly.

devices.title: NTFS Devices
devices.emptyHint: Please insert an NTFS formatted removable storage device
devices.mountConfirm: Are you sure you want to configure {name} as read-write mode?
devices.mountConfirmNote:
Note:
• This requires administrator privileges, and the system will prompt for a password
• If this NTFS device was previously used on a Windows computer with Fast Startup enabled, you may need to plug it back into the Windows computer and fully shut down before trying
devices.unmountConfirm: Are you sure you want to unmount {name}?
devices.ejectConfirm: Are you sure you want to eject {name}?
devices.ejectConfirmNote:
Note:
• After ejecting, the device will be completely disconnected from the system
• The device will be removed from the list and needs to be reinserted to use
• Please ensure no programs are using the device
devices.restoreConfirm: Are you sure you want to restore {name} to read-only mode?
devices.restoreConfirmNote: Note: This requires administrator privileges, and the system will prompt for a password
devices.ejectAllConfirm: Are you sure you want to eject all NTFS devices?
devices.ejectAllConfirmNote: Please ensure no programs are using these devices

logs.title: Operation Logs
logs.clearConfirm: Are you sure you want to clear all logs?

settings.title: Application Settings
settings.savePasswordDesc: When enabled, the app will securely save your administrator password using macOS Keychain for automatic input
settings.deletePasswordConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the saved password?
settings.deletePasswordError: Failed to delete password, please try again
settings.startupTabDesc: Select the default tab to display when the app starts
settings.enableLogsDesc: Disabled by default, requires manual activation. When enabled, the app will record all operation logs. When disabled, new logs will not be recorded, but previously recorded logs will still be retained. Logs are saved for a maximum of 30 days by default
settings.resetLogsDailyDesc: When enabled, the app will automatically clear the previous day's logs on the first launch each day
settings.exportLogsDesc: Export all operation logs as a text file
settings.windowSizeDesc: Customize the width and height of the application window (in pixels). Changes will take effect after restarting the application
settings.trayModeDesc: When enabled, closing the window will minimize to the system tray instead of quitting the app. You can quickly manage NTFS devices through the tray icon.
settings.autoStartDesc: When enabled, the app will automatically launch when the system starts

tray.quitConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to quit the application?
tray.tooltip:
Nigate - NTFS Device Management
Click to display device list

messages.enterPassword: Tip: Please enter the administrator password in the dialog that appears

passwordDialog.title: Administrator Privileges Required
passwordDialog.prompt: Please enter your Mac account login password:
passwordDialog.passwordParseError: Unable to parse password input: password is empty
passwordDialog.mountDeviceRetry: Mount device {name} as read-write mode (please re-enter password)

messages.noDevicesToMount: No devices to configure (all devices are already configured as read-write)
messages.noDevicesToUnmount: No devices mounted in read-write mode
messages.mountAllStart: Starting to configure {count} devices as read-write mode...
messages.mountAllSuccess: Successfully configured {count} devices as read-write mode
messages.restoreAllStart: Starting to restore {count} devices to read-only mode...
messages.restoreAllSuccess: Successfully restored {count} devices to read-only mode

about.title: About
about.description: Nigate is a free tool for reading and writing NTFS formatted storage devices, based on the ntfs-3g driver.
about.author: Author:
